name: Crowne Plaza Stabiae Sorrento Coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel after extensive research about nice hotels in the area that weren't in the VERY expensive price range. We stayed here near the end of our honeymoon after a few days on the Amalfi Coast. The hotel was fabulous, especially for the price, but you have to watch out for that Italian arrogance because the staff here are not exempt from treating you like the tourist you are.
reviews.title: Great Hotel- Beware of Italian Schemes

likes.disliked: — The staff & the constant irregular billing on meals.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the Italian way it was a great hotel. It is close to Pompeii but be sure to take the highway there by car (renting your car is the only way to go if you stay at this hotel). If you drive right through Catellammare Di Stabia from Pompeii you are in for seeing the real Italian streets. Dirty and full of trash (if there is a trash strike, and there often is).... Campania was on trash strike the whole week we were there so there were burning piles of trash in the streets of this town. Of course the tourist towns on the Amalfi Coast and Sorrento Penn. were kept beautiful and the trash was hidden away somewhere away from our tourist wallets...
reviews.title: FANTASTIC******

likes.disliked: — Maybe the location but we had a car so it was no problem

reviews.text: Back to the hotel- I book a room that was guaranteed a sea view and somehow we got a room that had a deck! It was lovely, I reccomend spending the extra money for the deck. Mount Vesuvious just stares at you when you wake up in the morning. We were also given a complementary bottle of champaigne with strawberries which was a bonus. The bathroom was larger than mine at home and very comfortable acoomodations.
reviews.title: COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER

reviews.text: A few things to beware of ... We were over charged several times during meals, they were happy to change the bill each time but you have to watch them. Some staff come off as snide, but that seems to be most of the Italians in tourist areas. Italians outside tourist areas are nice. The ladies at the spa were especially rude but at some point that seems to be the norm at spas like theirs.
reviews.title: A Luxurious Haven

likes.disliked: — Swimming pool too cold in October

reviews.text: The building is an old concrete factory and is really fun! The drive to Sorrento is pretty but sometimes congested!
reviews.title: Converted Cement Factory - Though v. pleasant on the inside!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights for a relaxing break, and had an amazing time. As a platinum priority club member, we were upgraded to a fabulous room - one window overlooking the coast, the other across the bay at Vesuvius - and a massive private terrace!!
reviews.title: Amazing Room
Beautiful views and nice hotel, but a bit out of the way
reviews.text: The hotel is a way out of the main town, but the location is beautiful and just right if you want to explore. We had a hire car from the airport which was lots of fun although my partner soon got used to the Italian driving and was driving like a local within 24 hrs! As we went out of season the traffic was just fine - and the weather was near to perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel - all the facilities we could ask for, beautiful sunsets, a fabulous view, lovely food in the restaurant (not the cheapest, but convenient so we were happy with it!) ... and plenty of free parking.
reviews.title: A Superb Hotel

likes.liked: — The wide terraces and particularly our room and large terrace
likes.disliked: — Lack of UK news on TV

reviews.text: I would go back tomorrow if I could - the only complaint was that we ONLY booked 4 nights!!!
reviews.title: Happy with this hotel

likes.liked: — Private beach area and pool area

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Crowne Plaza Di Stabea and were overall pleased. The property is just beautiful with it's views, swimming pool and private beach. The biggest drawback is the limited transportation offered by the hotel to Sorrento. If you did not arrive by car or do not rent one when you are there, the times and space on the courtesy shuttle are very limited. Luckily it worked out for us, but if a family of 4 were staying and reserved seats on the shuttle that would only leave 4 more spaces. I think it might be a problem during the busy season. We were there mid September. Also, there is a local bus that can be picked up outside the hotel on the road. It is a nice "tour" style bus. Very comfortable and only 4 euro a piece to ride.
reviews.title: A 4-star oasis on the Bay of Naples

reviews.text: I have just returned from the Crowne Plaza Hotel and in general i have nothing but good things to say about it, the location is fantastic, the staff were friendly and the hotel was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Spot

reviews.text: The only things on the negative side was that the beach was not open when we were there, and the courtesy shuttle bus only runs to one location and only in the early evening. Also at breakfast time you are only allowed to have the american breakfast at a cost of 20 euros, so even if you only have coffee and cereal as i did you are charged the price of a full breakfast.
reviews.title: Fine Choice on Sorrento Coast
Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: If you have the chance, do as we did and go to Capri for a evening, its expensive but well worth the extra euros.

reviews.title: A must stay if in the area
reviews.text: Nice, modern hotel with good access to Sorrento Coast locations, Pompei and other excavation sites, and Naples. This location makes a better base for touring the area than, say, Sorrento. Breakfast was very good. Beautiful view of Mt. Vesuvius across the bay.

reviews.title: Vesuvius Rocks!
reviews.text: As getting to the train is difficult, even when connecting via hotel's infrequent shuttle (and the closest train station, which is walkable but closed, except in summer), a car is essential, in my opinion. Parking is free in a guarded garage, a nice plus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just come back from a week staying at the Crowne Plaza, and can say without hesitation that it was a superb hotel. To say I'm fussy is an understatement (I'm the one who notices if the grouting is dirty in the bathroom!) so I was really relieved when we arrived here. The first view you have as you drive down to the entrance is gorgoeus - out over the Bay of Naples with Vesuvious directly infront of you, and so close! The hotel itself is modern and contemporary with a very light and airy feel. The staff were faultless, from reception who went out of their way to assisit, to the doormen, pool staff and everyone else we spoke to. Our room was clean and modern with everything you could need, with a bath (vital!) and a shower. I guess the only negative might be our balcony. It was a small decking area with a wooden square coffee table and 2 chairs, which was right next to the room on our left and 3 further rooms to our right in a sort of semi-circle. The only thing dividing them was a railed partition. However, as we only saw one other couple out on theirs fleetingly it really wasn't a problem, as we only spent the odd 10 mins here out on it ouselves. The pool is gorgoeus, with ample loungers and towels. The small private beach is a godsend. The restaurant setting is just lovely - outside overlooking the bay and Vesuvious. The whole area is lit by oil burners and candles - very romantic. The staff were discreet, polite and helpful - we are both vegetarians and the chef made us wonderful pasta dishes on the 2 nights we ate there. Some reviews on this hotel have been negative about the area and I was prepared to be disappointed but really it is not atall bad. Ok, it's not up in the mountains of Ravello, but we drove everywhere anyway so never even thought about it. However, the driving is something else. Be warned! We read all the stuff about the Amalfi Coast drive and the scooters and driving standards, but really, nothing prepares you for just how horrific it is. There are dozens of scooters everywhere, often they ride without helmets, and believe it or not, often 2 on a bike with a tiny child wedged inbetween or a baby slung on the womans hip. The scooters and cars overtake on blind bends constantly or cut across infront of you. You need to be a very confident and assertive driver! It was also crazily busy and frentic. We visited Sorrento via the hotel courtesy bus, but didn't much like it. We went to The Foreigners Club on several recommendations from this website for a light lunch and I have to say it was vile! Perhaps others ate in the evning but I had a cheese and tomatoe roll (all on offer for a vegetarian) and it was a burger roll and disgusting. The service was surly but the view was nice. We also visited Positano - pretty but very touristy, Ravello - our favourite, views to die for and a bit quiter, and t"Vico Equenzie" the next town on from the hotel where we ate in a restaurant recommended by the hotel one night which was very good. We spent a day walking round Pompei which is only about 15 mins away, a serious "must see" and walked up the the top of Mount Vesuvious on the only day it wasn't shrouded in mist! Also a "must see, but this is a steep walk up and you need flat shoes, preferably trainers not the strappy stilletos I saw one young girl staring off in! So a great hotel - definitely go stay !!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - highly recommend !
Beautiful View from a Modern Room
reviews.text: A wonderful view and a small balcony. Right outside the floor to ceiling glass door you can practically touch Vesuvio. Magical experience. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Room was modern with a the conveniences one might come to expect. Room Service is worht the price. We stayed in the off season and had a wonderful time. Only regret is that we didn't have enough time. 2 nights is not enough to get a feel for the area. I can still smell the wood burning ovens and stoves if I close my eyes and imagine. GO!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know everyone says this place is out of the way, but really there is nowhere "in the way" on the Sorrento and Amalfi Coasts. This place is in a great central location because you can go see Naples and Pompeii AND all of the coastal towns. The hotel itself is 20 minutes from Sorrento which is a great place to start all your day trips to the coastal towns and islands, and 20 minutes from Pompeii. The best hidden secret is the Circumvesuviana train which will take you anywhere all the way from Naples to Sorrento. The hotel also has a shuttle and free bus passes but the best and easiest way to get around is via the Circumvesuviana stop at Pozzano which is 1/2 mile or less from the hotel, right next to the public beach. Only thing is the Circ skips it late at night and you have to walk up a tunnel to get to it, but it is so easy and usually free since no one ever checks your tickets.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been happier

likes.disliked: — Lack of tv channels but who wants to stay inside when you are there anyways

reviews.text: That being said . . .
reviews.title: Stunning hotel, average location!

reviews.text: The hotel was the best deal around during high season, everything is new and clean and everyone is so helpful. Dinner at the hotel restaurant was delicious and having a private beach is truly a treat on the coast. The public ones get so crowded.
reviews.title: Hospitable, beautifuul hotel

aka: Crowne Plaza Stabiae Sorrento Coast Hotel Castellammare Di Stabia
description: Crowne Plaza Stabiae Sorrento Coast is a modernly designed 4 star superior hotel located on the Sorrento Coastline, overlooking the bay of Naples. Crowne Plaza Stabiae Sorrento Coast, at only few Km from Naples Airport, is suitable both for business and individual travellers. . The closest train stations are C/mare di Stabia and Vico Equense.The Crowne Plaza Stabiae Sorrento Coast boasts 150 soundproofed rooms , equipped with all comforts and WI-FI Internet connection.
